output.conclusion: By completing this course, you will have a strong understanding of key cybersecurity concepts and be prepared to tackle intermediate-level security challenges.
output.introduction: Welcome to Intermediate Cybersecurity! This course builds upon foundational knowledge and delves into more complex security topics. Each module is designed to take approximately 10 minutes to read, providing a concise yet comprehensive learning experience.

chapters.description: Review of network protocols (TCP/IP, UDP), common network devices (routers, switches, firewalls), and basic network security principles.
Understanding the importance of network segmentation, VLANs, and subnetting for security.
Hands-on practice with configuring firewall rules and access control lists (ACLs).
Overview of OWASP Top 10 vulnerabilities, including SQL injection, XSS, and CSRF.
Best practices for writing secure code, input validation, and output encoding.
Introduction to WAFs and their role in protecting web applications.
Introduction to encryption algorithms (AES, RSA), hashing functions (SHA-256), and digital signatures.
Best practices for generating, storing, and managing cryptographic keys.
Understanding the TLS/SSL protocol and its role in securing communication over the internet.
Developing an incident response plan, including roles, responsibilities, and communication protocols.
Basic techniques for analyzing malware samples, including static and dynamic analysis.
Introduction to digital forensics principles and techniques for collecting and analyzing digital evidence.
Understanding the purpose and process of security audits, including internal and external audits.
Using vulnerability scanners to identify security weaknesses in systems and applications.
Introduction to penetration testing methodologies and ethical hacking principles.
